snippet: Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey held an emergency meeting with top security officials amid a diplomatic effort to free the hostages in Mosul.
abstract: Turkish government reacts with alarm to seizure of country’s consul general and his staff by militants in Mosul, Iraq, vowing to retaliate if any of its citizens are wounded; 49 Turkish citizens from the consulate are being held hostage; another group of 31 Turks, truck drivers delivering fuel to a power plant in Mosul, are seized by Islamic State in Iraq and Syria militants.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey held an emergency meeting with top security officials amid a diplomatic effort to free the hostages in Mosul.

headline.main: Militants Storm Turkish Consulate in Iraqi City, Taking 49 People as Hostages
headline.print_headline: Militants Storm Turkish Consulate in Iraqi City, Taking 49 People as Hostages
